parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To hate, detest, love less, esteem less. From a primary misos; to detest; by extension, to love less.
Lawlessness, iniquity, disobedience, sin. From anomos; illegality, i.e. Violation of law or wickedness.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A sharer, partner, associate. From metecho; participant, i.e. a sharer; by implication, an associate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably akin to chraomai through the idea of contact; to smear or rub with oil, i.e. to consecrate to an office or religious service.
Olive oil, oil. Neuter of the same as elaia; olive oil.
Wild joy, ecstatic delight, exultation, exhilaration. From agalliao; exultation; specially, welcome.
